item.title: Integrative Cybernetics
item.description:
Identity

Integrative Cybernetics defines the control architecture governing coupling, coordination, and synchronization across emotional, cognitive, and somatic cybernetic layers.

It treats integration as system behavior, not synthesis of meanings or experiences.

Purpose

The purpose of Integrative Cybernetics is to formalize how multiple regulatory layers interact without collapse, and how coherence is maintained or lost under load.

It does not unify disciplines. It regulates interaction dynamics.

Domain of Governance

Integrative Cybernetics governs:

item.title: Integrity
item.description:
Identity

This space holds frameworks that protect system cleanliness over time.

They exist to prevent drift, misuse, accumulation of power, and internal corruption — without enforcement.

Integrity is not morality.
It is structural consistency.

When integrity fails, systems rot quietly.
These frameworks describe how that failure is avoided.

item.title: Somatic Cybernetics
item.description:
Identity

Somatic Cybernetics defines the control architecture that governs physiological regulation as a constraint system for intelligence and behavior.

It treats the body as a regulatory substrate, not as a signal source for interpretation or meaning.

Purpose

The purpose of Somatic Cybernetics is to formalize how bodily states constrain, modulate, and limit system behavior under real-world conditions.

It does not attempt to improve health or performance. It defines how regulation fails, saturates, compensates, or stabilizes.

item.title: Somatic Physics
item.description:
Identity

Somatic Physics defines the body as a physical system of signals, not as a biological object, health domain, or therapeutic target.

It studies how internal signals originate, propagate, accumulate, and discharge within the body as lawful physical behavior.

What This Physics Addresses

Somatic Physics focuses on:

  • signal accumulation and release
  • physical latency and load
  • internal pressure without conscious mediation
  • non-verbal state persistence
  • body-level constraint before cognition or emotion intervenes

The body here is not symbolic.
It is mechanical, temporal, and responsive.

item.title: Stability
item.description:
Identity

This space holds frameworks that speak to readiness.

They operate when a system is preparing to grow, take responsibility, or carry weight — but has not yet moved outward.

These frameworks do not accelerate change.
They stabilize the ground before movement begins.

If stability is absent, expansion fragments.
Nothing here attempts to bypass that reality.

Identity

They describe crossings between states — moments where old structures dissolve and new ones are not yet formed.

These frameworks are not meant for permanence.
They appear briefly, then disappear once a new equilibrium is reached.

Discomfort here is not a flaw.
It is a signal.
